snippet: The International Campaign to Ban Landmines attributed the drop to increased compliance with the Mine Ban Treaty, which was first signed 17 years ago.
abstract: International Campaign to Ban Landmines reports deaths and injuries from land mines and other explosive remnants of war fell to lowest level ever recorded in 2013, and that production of weapons appears to have practically ceased; group attributes declines to increased compliance with international Mine Ban Treaty that took effect in 1999.
lead_paragraph: The International Campaign to Ban Landmines attributed the drop to increased compliance with the Mine Ban Treaty, which was first signed 17 years ago.

headline.main: Land Mines Are Taking Smaller Toll, Group Says
headline.print_headline: Land Mines Are Taking Smaller Toll, Group Says

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
